title: Can you ever get your afk timer ban back to 5 minutes after you've made it to 20 minutes?
body: I hadn't afked for several months and then when the client suddenly decided to crash on me, leaving me with a black screen and having no way to close or change the tab. forcing me to restart my PC. When I logged in, my team had obviously remaked and I ended up with a 20 min ban, even though It had been months since the last one I got and I also had recieved a message telling me that I've been afking less in games and my account status has been improved. Any thoughts on this?

replies.body:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ

Unfortunately the FAQ doesn't tell you if you can go down the escalation path for leave buster... Can we get some red help on this?
I think it is based more on games played than on time since your last punishment like the IFS and you can drop tiers but I'm not 1000% sure.

AFKing 1/100 will fairly quickly bring you up to the maximum of 20 min LPQ. You have to AFK less than that to stay at whatever LPQ you are currently at.

To go down requires going AFK even less than that.

Once you've gone up to the top, it can take a while to prove that going AFK is no longer a habit.

The thing is that it wasn't my fault, the client bugged and all that could be seen was a black screen with me not being able neither to change tabs nor to close the loading screen, thus forcing me to restart. Then, they remaked. Also, could you explain what LPQ is?

LPQ is Low Priority Que, the wait time before joining a queue. You get 5 games of it when Leaverbuster gives a penalty. It generally starts at 5 minutes, but can go up to 20 minutes if the habit of leaving is severe.

Leaverbuster has leniency built into it, so that rare, random occurrences don't give a penalty. But, if you've used up the leniency, either with going AFK or with a bizarre series of mostly legitimate occurrences, then the system still wants you to realize that you're hurting the games of a lot of other people, and to plan your time better.
The question is, how long will it take for it to reset back to 5 minutes again and have the lenicency of a new account that hasn't afked at all?
If you AFK about 1/250 games or less, your LPQ should go down and eventually reset so that you don't get any LPQ when you AFK.
How can you be so sure? Have you asked a rioter or researched how LPQ works?

The basics are from the [Leaverbuster FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714), with additional insight from reds (RIoters).

The specific number of games required for Leaverbuster to decide to give LPQ or not comes from the threads where people complain about LPQ.
